attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Delay the Disability benefit cuts due in April 2017
attributes.background: These cuts will have a devastating effect on one of the most vulnerable and needy groups

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from entering UK until he lifts his muslim country travel ban
attributes.background: US President Donald Trump has imposed a ban on people from seven Muslim countries entering the US. This is in contravention of the Geneva convention and is a racist and immoral act. Let him know that the people of the UK do not want him to enter our country until he lifts this ban.

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Make the day we leave the EU a national holiday within the United Kingdom!
attributes.background: I believe the day the announcement is made stating that The United Kingdom has full left the EU we should have that date as a United Kingdom Bank Holiday and should be a day of reflection of how strong we are as a small country! 'National Brexit Day'!

attributes.action: Issue a formal condemnation of President Trump
attributes.background: Within his first week, Donald Trump has turned the back of the world's richest country on these fleeing unimaginable horrors; has outright lied to the media of the world; and in an astonishing declaration, happily condoned torture. The UK Government should immediately condemn his presidency.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is a free nation, and should stand up for what is right. Our government is failing us by refusing to object to Donald Trump's abhorrent actions. We must not let division, injustice, and prejudice go unopposed. I believe that we must challenge these actions for the safety and dignity of our country.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from entering the UK for 90 days too in solidarity with Iran
attributes.background: The United States of America has banned the citizens of Iran, along with those of Iraq, Libya, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen from entering the country for 90 days. To make a stand against such racial profiling, let's ban them too in solidarity with our brothers in those countries.

attributes.action: Contraceptive pill boxes to warn of major factors making the pill less effective
attributes.background: We would like legislation requiring manufacturers of contraceptive pills to clearly and prominently display a warning on the packaging showing the major factors in the pill being less effective. We would like a warning similar to that of a cigarette packet
attributes.additional_details: The side effects and health risk associated with all medication are contained on a large leaflet within the box. We would like to see the main factors causing the contraceptive pill to be less effective or ineffective printed in bold letters on the outside of the box. Many become pregnant each year believing that this will not happen as they have chosen to use the pill only to find that something else such as a bout of illness has stopped the pill working.

attributes.action: License all drone operators in the uk
attributes.background: Many drone owners operate their machines without training, are ignorant of the law and pose a danger to the well being and privacy of the general public. For those reasons they should be trained and licensed before flying these devices.

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: I call for all census data to be published 80 years after the date of the census
attributes.background: The 1921 census to be published in 2021 will be the last for 30 years. The 1931 census was destroyed by fire and there wasn't a 1941 census due to World War 2. We should come into line with the American Federal Census whose 1950 census will be published in 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The 1951 census should be published in 2031 to keep the 10 continuity. The census period would then be every 80 years before publication. The average age of people living is between 70 and 80 years. So you wouldn't contravene privacy laws.

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: Implement psychological well-being into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: A childs' development is fundamental for their continued success and well-being in later adult life. Schools should have a statutory responsibility to integrate psychological well-being education and support through integrating emotional coping and resilience strategies into the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people will experience a Mental Health issue in their lifetime. With Mental health being one of the main causes of the overall disease burden worldwide, and depression being the second largest cause of disability.

Educational establishments provide opportunity for students to develop academic, vocational, interpersonal and employability skills, yet fundamental psychological skills (i.e. coping, stress management) are very rarely discussed, let alone taught, understood or integrated.

attributes.action: More funding to domestic violence charities and provide more shelter for victims
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We believe not enough is done to support men and women who are victims of domestic violence. We want to see groups like Refuge get more funding to shelter victims and offer financial support to relocate them.

attributes.action: Enforce deadlines upon car insurance companies for the completion of claims
attributes.background: A person involved in an accident & not at fault, can wait months if the other side ignore their insurance company and don't respond, due to their being no deadline on a response from the other party. Insurance should have 28 days to investigate blame & escalate to a dispute process if no agreement

attributes.action: Ban fee paying 'private' schools so admission to all schools is based on merit.
attributes.background: Eton was founded in 1440, over 557 years ago. It is deplorable that we allow these schools to still operate in a society where they are totally out of place. When it comes to education, meritocracy is the most sensible answer. Keep Eton, the facility's, the teachers erase the price tag.
attributes.additional_details: Independent schools in the UK cost on average £13,000 a year per child, or 32.5% of the average two income household. This means that for the average citizen these schools are unfeasible. No wonder 27,000 children attending private schools are not UK citizens. This outrageously outdated system allows the elite to become richer, by granting them better educations. Oxford and Cambridge admit more Etonians each year than applicants from the whole country who qualify for free school meals, showing how these upper class elites can buy their way into life.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Stop the time limits on disabled and elderly bus passes.
attributes.background: The rules on a disabled or elderly bus pass is telling people who have them what times they can and can't take a bus journey Its discrimination and absolutely embarrassing to be turned away and declined to take your journey before 9am! Why have the bus pass holders got a bus pass curfew? Fair/Unfair
attributes.additional_details: Contact your local Council and ask for information on times you can use your bus pass. Its like we have to be controlled and they tell us what we can and can't do.

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Limit the amount in which uk councils can charge on council tax
attributes.background: Limit the amount councils can charge for council tax as recent years its getting out of control and hitting people hard.Councils also say they have to make cuts yet councils over spend on silly projects and waste money on useless departments. Better surport is needed to be given to those who strugle
attributes.additional_details:
Burton on trent east staffs wasted 30.000 on a plastic ice rink that they made a loss on and sold off for a loss. 

Amber valley wastes money on staff who are unhelpfull and heartless. 

Councils need to offer better surport to those who fall in to bad times not threaten them and make the situation harder.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Minimum 3 month driving ban and £1k fine if caught using a mobile phone driving.
attributes.background: Using a hand held mobile phone while driving can have the same consequences as drink driving. Drivers caught not using hands free devices should be subject to a minimum 3 month driving ban and a minimum £1000 fine. The only way we can try and stop this is by imposing tougher laws.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).
